O2.sentence: Commercialization in productive chains, building infrastructure to provide logistics in health matters, and building the capacity of the communities through job training and employment.

Other benefits to community and biodiversity include the number of training actions for local people and employment generated by the project, benefiting disadvantaged groups such as women and older people.
Financial institutions will be hired to explore participation and secure financial support for project development.

O3.sentence: Training and socialization activities in the Indigenous Reservation have been monitored, ensuring dissemination of project results and strengthening community governance.

The 2015 training workshop for Indigenous facilitators equipped local authorities and young people with GIS management skills and increased awareness of forest protection, strengthening community stewardship.
The Family Agrifood Production Units system produced 4,000 tons annually and trained 800 students.

O5.sentence: Each year a budget is established for the activity of verifying the project and registering forest compensation units for avoided deforestation, providing the economic capacity to cover the costs and expenses of this activity and any additional events that may arise.

The compensations received for environmental services provided by preventing deforestation and contributing to the conservation of RIU‑SM forests are invested in benefits for the indigenous peoples of RIU‑SM through the budgetary execution of the REDD+ Project RIU‑SM.

It aims to manage the lands and forests of this region by establishing measures to reduce vulnerability to external agents, setting self-sustaining production systems, and managing a funding mechanism.

O6.sentence: The community is in favor of the established agroforestry projects, the benefits received during the pandemic, school supplies delivered to the entire student population, training of indigenous captains and guards, work tools, and drinking water projects, among others.

Support indigenous initiatives to develop projects, businesses, and infrastructure for their economic growth and occupation, including options to implement clean energy procurement (see implementation results of Project Activity A1.2 on improvement of communication, information, and transport mechanisms, page 79 of this Monitoring Report, and Project Activity A2.3 on developing projects in productive chains, page 126 of this Monitoring Report).
